content.Funding: At the time there is enough evidence that supports lead as ototoxic agent in humans (Carlson et al., 2018; Hemmativaghef, 2020. One study in adults exposed to lead without noise exposure (>85 dB), showed an increased hearing threshold at high frequencies (>3 kHz), as well as further peripheral and central auditory dysfunction (Castellanos and Fuente, 2016). Another study in children exposed to lead due to elec- tronic waste (e-waste) showed an increased hearing threshold at low frequencies (<2 kHz), even though the children showed low BPb levels (<5 μg/dL) (Liu et al., 2018). These results support that safe limit for lead should be discuss in order to prevent hearing impairment, Hem- mativaghef, 2020 based on significative association studies conclude that a BPb >2 μg/dL is the Lowest Observed Adverse Effect Level (LOAEL) for hearing damage. In our study participants were asked about occupational and leisure noise activities. We observed in audiograms that participants showed a notch related with noise exposure. Actually, noise exposure is a public health problem. Global Burden of Disease 2010 estimated that 1⋅3 billion people are affected by hearing loss and investigators rated hearing loss as the 13th most important contributor (19⋅9 million years, 2⋅6% of total number) to the global years lived with disability (YLD) (Vos and Flxman, 2012). Hearing impairment due to noise exposure could affect by a one-time exposure to an intense impulse sound, or by steady state long-term exposure. Thus, the results that we observed in our participants could be related to noise and lead exposure through life history. The characteristic pathological feature of noise-induced hearing loss is the loss of auditory sensory cells in the cochlea. Because these hair cells cannot regenerate in mammals, no remission can occur; prevention of noise-induced hearing loss is the only option to preserve hearing (Basner et al., 2014). At the molecular level lead is a mimetic for calcium in different cells and tissues (Marchetti, 2013). In the inner ear, the otoconia are the main calcium deposits for the auditory system. Otolin-1 protein plays an important role in storing calcium ions at the basilar and tectorial membranes in the cochlea (Yang et al., 2011). New evidence suggests that the outer hair cells response decreases when calcium stores are altered by exposure noise or calcium chelators (Strimbu et al., 2019). At the time there is no evidence that otolin-1 is affected by noise or calcium chelator exposures. Even though we observed a nonsignificant trend of a decrease in otolin-1 levels by BPb and increased hearing threshold, more studies are needed to evaluate whether otolin-1 levels could be affected by lead exposure. The motor protein prestin increases the length of the outer hair cells to improve sound discrimination and hearing response acting incochlear amplification. Bioinformatic studies suggest that prestin is functionally regulated by calcium/calmodulin (CaM) binding sites, and the CaM- prestin interaction may be involved in the modulation of cochlear amplification (Keller et al., 2014). Hearing loss is a multifactorial and age-specific disease, and lifestyle habits, health status, ototoxicity and noise exposure are important risk factors (Aghazadeh-Attari et al., 2017). The participants in the present study showed a chronic exposure to lead due to work or LGC habits over years, as we showed in multiple regression analysis. We observed that women over 39 years old without MSR and low BPb levels showed the highest serum prestin concentration. Some studies suggest that hearing function in women after menopause is diminished due to the decrease in estrogen levels (Hederstierna et al., 2007). One study evaluated prestin expression in ovariectomized rats and reported a decrease in the amount of prestin RNA, which correlated with an increase in hearing threshold (Diao et al., 2019). In addition to the evidence that the lack of estrogens is related to hearing loss, the presence of MSR plays an important role in hearing capacity as it modifies the composition of the inner ear membrane system (Aghaza- deh-Attari et al., 2017). Similarly, there is evidence that chronic expo- sure to lead can increase the MSR (Planchart et al., 2018). Our study has some limitations that should be considered. The cross- sectional design does not allow us to establish causation for our results. Patella X-ray measurement is the main biomarker for chronic exposure to lead. In our study, we used the BPb as a biomarker because it is a more accessible measure. As we could not measure noise exposure for each participant, we asked them about noise exposure habits, as shown in Table 2. For further studies related to hearing biomarkers and ototox- icity, noise exposure should be measured individually considered as an important control variable. 5. Conclusion This is the first study to evaluate prestin as a potential biomarker for hearing loss due to lead exposure. We concluded that the serum protein prestin concentration decreases according to hearing threshold related to lead exposure. We observed that lead exposure plays an important role in hearing threshold aside environmental noise exposure, in future studies should be considered as an important variable. The molecular bases of hearing impairment, such as overexposure to ototoxic agents, are similarly poorly understood and an area of active research. Hearing impairment due to noise exposure could affect by a one-time exposure to an intense impulse sound, or by steady state long-term exposure. Thus, the results that we observed in our participants could be related to noise and lead exposure through life history. The characteristic pathological feature of noise-induced hearing loss is the loss of auditory sensory cells in the cochlea. Because these hair cells cannot regenerate in mammals, no remission can occur; prevention of noise-induced hearing loss is the only option to preserve hearing (Basner et al., 2014). At the molecular level lead is a mimetic for calcium in different cells and tissues (Marchetti, 2013). In the inner ear, the otoconia are the main calcium deposits for the auditory system. Otolin-1 protein plays an important role in storing calcium ions at the basilar and tectorial membranes in the cochlea (Yang et al., 2011). New evidence suggests that the outer hair cells response decreases when calcium stores are altered by exposure noise or calcium chelators (Strimbu et al., 2019). At the time there is no evidence that otolin-1 is affected by noise or calcium chelator exposures. Even though we observed a nonsignificant trend of a decrease in otolin-1 levels by BPb and increased hearing threshold, more studies are needed to evaluate whether otolin-1 levels could be affected by lead exposure. The motor protein prestin increases the length of the outer hair cells to improve sound discrimination and hearing response acting incochlear amplification. Bioinformatic studies suggest that prestin is functionally regulated by calcium/calmodulin (CaM) binding sites, and the CaM- prestin interaction may be involved in the modulation of cochlear amplification (Keller et al., 2014). Hearing loss is a multifactorial and age-specific disease, and lifestyle habits, health status, ototoxicity and noise exposure are important risk factors (Aghazadeh-Attari et al., 2017). The participants in the present study showed a chronic exposure to lead due to work or LGC habits over years, as we showed in multiple regression analysis. We observed that women over 39 years old without MSR and low BPb levels showed the highest serum prestin concentration. Some studies suggest that hearing function in women after menopause is diminished due to the decrease in estrogen levels (Hederstierna et al., 2007). One study evaluated prestin expression in ovariectomized rats and reported a decrease in the amount of prestin RNA, which correlated with an increase in hearing threshold (Diao et al., 2019). In addition to the evidence that the lack of estrogens is related to hearing loss, the presence of MSR plays an important role in hearing capacity as it modifies the composition of the inner ear membrane system (Aghaza- deh-Attari et al., 2017). Similarly, there is evidence that chronic expo- sure to lead can increase the MSR (Planchart et al., 2018). Our study has some limitations that should be considered. The cross- sectional design does not allow us to establish causation for our results. Patella X-ray measurement is the main biomarker for chronic exposure to lead. In our study, we used the BPb as a biomarker because it is a more accessible measure. As we could not measure noise exposure for each participant, we asked them about noise exposure habits, as shown in Table 2. For further studies related to hearing biomarkers and ototox- icity, noise exposure should be measured individually considered as an important control variable. 5. Conclusion This is the first study to evaluate prestin as a potential biomarker for hearing loss due to lead exposure. We concluded that the serum protein prestin concentration decreases according to hearing threshold related to lead exposure. We observed that lead exposure plays an important role in hearing threshold aside environmental noise exposure, in future studies should be considered as an important variable. The molecular bases of hearing impairment, such as overexposure to ototoxic agents, are similarly poorly understood and an area of active research. content.CoiStatement: The typical pattern of the damage in the CNS following OP exposure have been previously reported (Kadar et al., 1992, 1995; Collombet, 2011). In the present work, we emphasize the early onset of neural damage after intoxication. Apoptosis was found to account for only a small portion of cell loss and themajority of neuronal death is probably due to necrosis associated with severe astrocytosis. The notion of time dependent differential treatment suggested here should be examined in future studies. Conflict of interest All authors declare no conflict of interest. content.Compliance with ethical standards: The progression of events following nerve agent-induced seizures can conceptually be divided into three phases. An early phase lasting about 5 min is dominated by cholinergic overactivity followed by a transitional phase of cholinergic and glutamatergic hyperactivity and finally a predominantly glutamatergic phase after about 40 min (McDonough and Shih, 1997). The results obtained in the present study seem to be in compliance with these phases. Seizure activity emerging as a result of insufficient prophylactic treatment was successfully terminated by scopolamine (1 mg/kg) 3 min after onset. Scopolamine injected 10 min following onset of seizures did not result in termination. Furthermore, additional adjunct therapy consisting of diazepam and pentobarbital terminated the seizures when administered 15–20 min following onset. The latter finding is consistent

In conclusion, the results of the present study demon- strate that repeated treatment with BGD in rats with a genetically based Cu storage disease effectively removes Cu from the body through biliary excretion and prevents resulting hepatopathology. BGD has several advantages over chelators presently used in Wilson’s disease, including lower toxicity and the absence of Cu redistribution to the brain, which make it a good candidate for clinical trials. content.CoiStatement: The results obtained in the present study clearly indicate that CoQ10 offers neuroprotection at the mitochondrial level in the nigrostriatal system against oxidative stress induced by dichlorvos. In conclusion, we report here that the dichlorvos induced nigrostriatal neuronal death produces the characteristic alterations in the behavioral pattern, which is further corroborated by the biochemical alterations in the various classical parameters. Furthermore, pre- treating rats with CoQ10 before dichlorvos exposure leads to a restoration of behavioral impairments and nigrostriatal integrity by reversing the effect and restoring near normal levels of mitochondrial ETC activity, TH expression, and of DA levels. Therefore, low level chronic CoQ10 pretreatment appears to act as an antioxidant and hence scavenges free radicals, enhances mitochondrial functions as well as protects dopaminergic neurons and thus rescues the compromised cells and reverses dopaminergic lesions and behavioral impairments. Further studies to understand the dose responses effects of CoQ10 and sequence of events would be worth investigating. content.CoiStatement: The results obtained fromSANG treated acetic acid-induced colitis in the present study are in well correlation with our previous results of its ability to inhibits the expression of inflammatorymediators and general inflammation both in vivo and in vitro. Additionally, our previous stud- ies clearly suggested that sanguinarine inhibited the activation of MAPK, which altered inflammatory mediator synthesis and release in vitro (Niu et al., 2012). In conclusion, the results of the present report demonstrate that SANG pre-treatment exerts beneficial effects in a mice model of colitis induced by the acetic acid. We observed that SANG administration significantly decreased colonic damage, colonic MPO activity and expression of pro-inflammatory mediators IL-6 and TNF-α. These protective effects were associated with a reduced level of p65 NF-κB subunit in the nucleus. Thus, we propose that the anti-inflammatory activity of SANG may be mediated, at least in part, by inhibition of the expression of certain pro-inflammatory mediators, which are regulated by the NF-κB signalling pathway. Our data support previous research suggesting that NF-κB may be a new and effective therapy target in IBD patients. Human studies would be beneficial in elucidating the effects of SANG more clearly. content.CoiStatement: A number of conclusions might be drawn from current study. i) CUR showed protective effect against the POD induced cytotoxicity by recovering G2/M arrest and reducing the change of membrane po- tential. ii) CUR could decrease the mortality rate of rats and protect the live and kidney's functions with decreased ALT, AST, AKP, LDH, Cr, BUN and MDA levels, but elevated SOD and GSH activities. iii) The mechanisms might be due to the competitive binding of CUR with POD in the same colchicines binding site as revealed by the tu- bulin polymerization assay and the molecular docking analysis, and the antioxidant activity against the oxidative stress induced by POD. iv) CUR showed protective effects against the POD poisoning both in vitro and in vivo. It could be used as a potential antidote to treat the POD intoxication in clinical practice. Conflict of interest There are no conflict of interest in this paper. Fig. 11. In the present study, we performed a comprehensive, proteomics- based analysis of the biological response to nanomaterials in order to obtain safety information. Protein matching will be an efficient method to evaluate the possibility of whetherMWCNTs cause disease, if the protein database related to all diseases is established, like the gene database related to genomic disease. To contribute to the protein database, we are gathering data regarding the changes in protein expression caused by exposing cells to various compounds. At the same time, we are verifying the biological response using a proteomics approach in vivo. These data will allow us to assess safety issues regarding CNTs and other nanomaterials in a more accurate way. In addition, the proteomics-based approach is likely to detect impurities, secondary influence, and response mechanism. content.CoiStatement: In summary, our results revealed that the sub-chronic fluoride exposure at environmentally relevant concentrations induces PT injury. This was clearly demonstrated by the increase of early and sensitive kidney injury biomarkers such as Kim-1, Clu, OPN, Hsp72, B2M and CysC at stages were renal function was not altered. To our knowledge, this is the first time that these early, non-invasive, sensitive and easily detected biomarkers have been used to assess the renal effects of fluoride exposure. PVC particles could be reduced by the removal of residual additives, this was not the case when the same particles were evaluated in a relevant in vivo bioassay involving a single intratracheal instillation. This is most likely due to the low intrinsic toxicity of emulsion PVC particles, even when they contain residual additives. An unexpected and as yet unex- plained finding was that the washed PVC particles caused an influx of eosinophils in the lungs. These findings show how difficult it is to extrapolate in vitro observations to the in vivo situation. Nevertheless, the pulmonary changes caused by a single intratracheal instillation of PVC particles were limited and reversible, unlike those found after silica particles. In summary, genes whose expressions have been previ- ously correlated with renal injury in rodents were evaluated in a nonhuman primate model. We were able to mine rat toxicogenomics data and confirm the usefulness as selected biomarkers in a non-rodent species. Based on our results, clusterin, HAVcr-1, and OPN gene expression changes are proposed as candidate predictive biomarkers of drug-in- duced nephrotoxicity in cynomolgus monkeys. Further- more, the use of a logistic regression model enabled us to rank candidate genomic biomarkers and compare them with accepted clinical biomarkers. Due to the limited number of drugs tested in our study and small number of test subjects, additional work is necessary to confirm and extend our observations. content.Acknowledgement: In conclusion, quercetin increased the prevalence of upward-curved tails. Mitochondrial dysfunction was also observed (lower basal and maximum respiration, and reduced ATP production), which is hypothe- sized to contribute to the developmental toxicity. In addition, lower ATP production and altered mstna and myoD expression is proposed to un- derlie, in part, the decrease in locomotor performance in larvae. The present study provides evidence that quercetin modulates the interac- tion between ATP production and locomotor behavior. content.CoiStatement: In summary, our data have demonstrated (Fig. 8) that the nature and extent of protein handling changes were quinone-specific. AC induced changes in most of the major protein handling systems examined including proteasomal activity, the ER stress response, autophagy and formation of aggresome-like inclusion bodies. Both BQ and AC induced proteasomal inhibition that was closely associated temporally with induction of the ER stress response and autophagy. The effect of NQO1 on modulating protein handling changes and toxicity was also quinone-specific.While two-electron reduction of BQ protected against toxicity, the unstable hydroquinones generated from AC and MD underwent rapid autoxidation to produce ROS leading to an activated ER stress response and increased toxicity. The present experimental protocol for irritation testing enables LDH and IL-1a measurement in a multipoint manner from a single culture well without disruption of culture as in many other irritation assays. A good correlation of LDH/IL-1a release induced by the test chemicals to PII was found and the best correlation was obtained by using LDH release. Although further studies are required with a range of skin irritants to validate the model, the present study suggests that the ROC model with its properly tight stratum corneum shows better prediction of skin irritation than the previously used reconstructed skin models do. content.CoiStatement: In conclusion,multiple events, including considerablemitochondrial ultrastructure impairments, inhibition of mitochondrial enzymes (enzymes of electron-transport chain and antioxidative defense), protein modification (GSSP formation) and lipid peroxidation due to free radical attack contribute to development of liver damage and dysfunction during chronic and acute CCl4 intoxication. Acute intoxication resulted in pronounced impairments of mitochondrial respiratory parameters. Despite numerous biochemical and morphologi- cal signs of intoxication after 30 days of toxic agent administration, an ad- aptation of mitochondrial respiratory parameters was observed. Long- termmelatonin administration preventedmarkedlymitochondrialmem- brane damage and enhanced regenerative processes in the liver. The hepatoprotective effect of melatonin is due to antioxidant, membrane- stabilizing and anti-inflammatory properties. The synergistic action of melatonin, succinate and plant polyphenols may be useful for clinical application. Conflict of interest statement The authors declare that there is no conflict of interest. PT via such a mechanism would not be expected to be locked by NAC. Accordingly, apoptosis induced by 400 mM FOA is more efficiently blocked by CsA than by NAC. The lack of complete inhibition of 400 mM PFOA-induced poptosis by either NAC or CsA might be due to the fact that FOA, as many other peroxisome proliferators, has strong ipophilicity i.e., ability to interact directly with lipids. Such an nteraction will alter the membrane architecture and lipid pack- ng, thereby providing a direct, physical, membrane altering echanism for perfluorinated fatty acid toxicity leading to ecrosis (Levitt et al., 1987). However, as we have shown reviously, treatment of HepG2 cells with PFOA concentra- ions up to 450 mM induces biochemical changes (DNA frag- is (Shabalina et al., 1999) and not necrosis. It is tempting to speculate that both accumulation of ROS nd disruption of DCm, could result in a self-amplifying loop, in which disruption of the mitochondrial compartments favors the accumulation of radicals and radical-mediated damage, as well as the breakdown of respiratory metabolism. Together, these events participate in the execution of the apoptotic path- way. In summary, we have shown evidence that PFOA exerts its cytotoxic effect through hypergeneration of ROS and mito- chondrial depolarization. This results in the activation of caspase-9, which in turn activates the apoptotic pathway. The addition of either a potent antioxidant or an MPT inhibitor reverses this apoptotic effect as shown by DNA histograms and lack of caspase-9 activation. S21 phosphorylation of EZH2 by Akt kinase has been first demon- strated in breast cancer cells treated with insulin-like growth factor I (IGF-I) or estrogen (Bredfeldt et al., 2010; Cha et al., 2005). In BEAS-2B cells, we had also noticed S21 phosphorylation of the EZH2 protein through the activation of the JNK-STAT3-Akt signaling axis in response to As3+ (Chen et al., 2013). The present report further unraveled the im- portance of oxidative stress or ROS in this As3+-induced EZH2 phos- phorylation, which confirmed our previous findings showing that As3+ is able to induce ROS generation in the non-transformed BEAS- 2B cells (Chang et al., 2010). Given the critical roles of ROS and EZH2 in human cancers related to environmental exposure, the data from this report may shed new light on the prevention or treatment of human lung cancer or other cancers resulting from environmental ex- posure to As3+ or other carcinogens. content.Funding: In conclusion, the present findings show that both Nox activation and mitochondrial respiration are involved in the altered lung O2 me- tabolism observed after ROFA inhalation. Nox activation seems to be a relevant non-mitochondrial source of reactive oxygen species in this model. The exposure to ROFA also impacts on mitochondrial function, leading to an increased electron transport rate (evidenced by the higher state 3 respiration), mitochondrial membrane depolarization, decreased ATP production rate and, consequently, deficient oxidative phosphorylation. This situation, known as mild mitochondrial uncoupling, may prevent the mitochondrial generation of reactive O2 species, which, in turn, could cause oxidative damage within the organelle. The results shown in this work provide new insights in the molecular mechanisms involved in lung injury by O2 metab- olism alterations triggered by PM inhalation. These results shed new light on the effects of nicotine in lung epithelium and its possible role in the development of a pre- malignant phenotype, since it promotes the differentiation towards lung neuroendocrine cells the main target for SCLC. But we cannot affirm from the data presented above that exposures to nicotine during a week were sufficient to induce cell transformation since, in spite of showing increase matrix degrading activity and cell adhesion, differentiated NHBE were not able to form colonies on soft agar (data not shown). Longer exposures to nicotine will be needed to study the induction genetic lessions possibly through its direct intervention on the DNA. That the cytoprotective effect of COX-1 is a broad phenomenon with direct practical pharmacological implica- tions for SM-induced skin toxicity induced by SM can thus be concluded from numerous reports. On the other hand, the pronounced pro-inflammatory effect of COX-2, demonstrat- ed in the present study and numerous other investigations, should be considered while designing drugs of choice for the treatment of SM-exposed skin. To use this information in the best and most efficacious way, investigators must better understand the mechanism(s) underlying the various effects of the different enzymatic activities of the COX systems in skin at the cellular, subcellular, and biochemical levels. In conclusion, we have demonstrated greater abundance of IGF-I mRNA and protein in leiomyomas relative to the normal myometrium of the same individual uterus. IGF-I expression in leiomyoma cells was down-regulated by SB, indicating that SB may participate in inhibition of leio- myoma growth. Data indicate that reduction of proliferation in SB-treated is associated with decreased amounts of IGF-I mRNA and protein. From the raw materials, the five compounds were isolated and the chemical structures of resveratrol, baicalin, berberine, apigenin, and luteolin were determined. Of them, two flavonoids of apigenin and luteolin were inhibitory for the growth of LM cells, suggesting that flavonoids of apigenin and luteolin are potentially useful for the development of therapeutic treat- ments of cancer. These observations suggest a role for SB in growth inhibition of leiomyomal cells. Taken together, the present study suggests that SB inhibited leiomyomal cell growth mediated by IGF-I in human uterus. content.Compliance with ethical standards: Competitive AhR ligand displacement assay. Male Sprague–Dawley rats weighing 225–250 g were obtained from Harlan, Indianapolis, IN. Animals were housed in wire-bottom cages at a 12/12 h light/dark cycle, 22 °C ambient temperature, and a relative humidity of 40–60%. All rats had ad libitum access to water and 8604RodentDiet supplied byHarlanTeklad,Madison,WI. The research presentedwas conducted in compliancewithNIHGuidance for theCare andUse of Animals and was approved by the KUMC Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee. Preparation of cytosolic protein and the binding assay were performed as described elsewhere (Bradfield et al., 1988; Bradfield and Poland, 1988). In brief, rats received a lethal injection of pentobarbital and livers were perfused with cold 150mMKCl(aq), adjusted to pH7.4. The tissue was homogenized inMDENG buffer containing 25 mM 3-(N-morpholino)-propane sulfonic acid, 0.02% sodium azide, 1 mM ethylenediaminotetraacetate, 10% (w/v) glycerol, and 1 mM dithiothreitol and adjusted to pH 7.5. A 12,000×g supernatant was prepared by centrifugation at 4 °C for 20 min. Ultracentrifugation (440,000×g for 25 min) Fig. 3. Competitive displacement of 3H-TCDD from its specific binding site on the AhR by increasing concentrations of TCDD, Me-TCPT, and its sulfoxides. yielded hepatic cytosol, containing the AhR in the supernatant. Aliquots were stored at −80 °C until use. Protein content was determined using the Better Bradford assay by Pierce Biotechnology, Inc., Rockford, IL, and cytosol was diluted with buffer to 5 mg/ml protein for assaying. The solvent for all compounds was dimethylsulfoxide. Four experiments were run in triplicate, each using 200 μl cytosol, in order to measure: • Total binding of TCDD: cytosol+1 μl of 200 nM 3H-TCDD. • Non-specific binding of TCDD: a) + 1 μl of 20 μM 3,3′,4,4′-

content.CoiStatement: In this study, we found a significant association between high Cd and Pb exposure and increased UC risk. Cigarette smoking and herb medi- cine were important factors for UC risk after adjustment for other po- tential risk factors. In addition, we observed the possible association between DNA hypomethylation and UC risk (Q4 vs. Q3). Repeat mea- surements of heavy metals in the study design, detailed dietary infor- mation, and types of herb medicine are recommended for exploring UC carcinogenesis in future studies. content.CoiStatement: The ITER database provides risk assessors with chronic human health risk assessment data from a variety of organizations world- wide in a format that allows for easy comparison. The RiskIE database offers notifications of in progress chemical risk assessment work that promotes networking and collaboration among organiza- tions. RiskIE spans a much larger scope of risk assessment work, and serves as a complement to ITER. ITER currently exists on the TOXNET compilation of databases, and RiskIE will soon join ITER on TOXNET. Together, the ITER and RiskIE databases provide risk assessors essential tools for readily locating and comparing available risk data, sharing progress of work, and collaborating among organizations to reduce duplication of effort. Evaluation of the relevance of the olfactory lesion to a human health risk assessment of H2S exposure must take into account the significant differences between the breath- ing styles and nasal anatomy of rodents and humans (Dor- man et al., 1997). First, rats and mice may be more predisposed to nasal lesions than humans because they are obligatory nasal breathers. Second, a larger portion of the rodent nasal cavity is lined by olfactory mucosa (50%) relative to humans (10%). Third, the olfactory mucosa in the caudal region of the rat and mouse nose lines a complex network of ethmoid turbinates that greatly expands the surface area available for chemical uptake and slows the speed of air flow, enhancing the deposition efficiency of inhaled toxicants (Proctor and Changm, 1983). These fac- tors increase the likelihood that an inhaled chemical in the rodent nose will reach the olfactory mucosa at a local concentration sufficient to cause toxicity and, with time, a histologic lesion. Additional research will be required to determine the significance of the rat and mouse olfactory lesion to an assessment of risk to human health from subchronic exposure to relatively low levels of H2S. Comment 7: We are not rejecting or criticizing the DCM PBPK models themselves that have been developed using assumptions of 2E1/GSTmetabolism of DCM.We have employed thesemodels for our own analyses and have used similar assumptions of two-pathway metabolism for comparative purposes. There was no “ease” or “casualness” in our examination of the evidence for DCM and the analyses we did. We are pointing out that the two-pathway model is based on the assumption that CYP2E1 has only one active site with very tight affinity. However, CYP2E1 is versatile in that it can metabolize both very small and very large molecules. We note current literature that describes hinges within the molecule that can open alternate pathways that accommodate the largermolecules. This is the same concept that we are applying to DCM as an alternate hypothesis. We advocate an examination of the data and acknowledgement of the uncertainties regarding the specificity of support of DCM data for the existing hypothesis. We encourage further examination and develop- ment of data for DCM MOA implications and assumptions regarding the dilution of human risk from exposure to this chemical. Rather than supporting a policy-driven approach, we are advocating a science- based approach. Such an approach includes acknowledging the uncertainties and discrepancies between the data and the existing two-pathway hypothesis, the non-specificity of the experimental data to distinguish between two-site and two-pathway PBPK modeling of DCM metabolism in vivo, and the need for further examination of the two-site hypothesis as a MOA of DCM-induced effects.
